column5: I know this really has nothing to do with fishing but I couldn't resist sharing this with my fellow OFC members There looks to be a good show on tomorrow night (Thursday) on cbc at 8:00 pm called Wolverine : Ghost of the Northern Forest (Nature of Things) I seen a preview on it this evening and it looked pretty good and definitely worth an hour of my time . Thought a few of you might enjoy something like this and I know from past posts some members have actually had encounters with these elusive animals . Enjoy
cool thanks for sharing, ill have to PVR it because won't be in the house at that time

I know this really has nothing to do with fishing but I couldn't resist sharing this with my fellow OFC members There looks to be a good show on tomorrow night (Thursday) on cbc at 8:00 pm called Wolverine : Ghost of the Northern Forest (Nature of Things) I seen a preview on it this evening and it looked pretty good and definitely worth an hour of my time . Thought a few of you might enjoy something like this and I know from past posts some members have actually had encounters with these elusive animals . Enjoy  They are pretty cool critters. The last one I saw was in the middle of winter as it walked past the end of my driveway.
Never seen one.  Wish too one day  Amazing creatures
Here's a pic from one of the camps on the winter road to the diamond mines a buddy sent me a few years ago.
That guy doesn't look to elusive Drifter , almost looks like someone's pet looking for some dinner !
Hahaj I remember you posting that!  Kinda hard to believe how fierce they can be eh?
Yes I was going to add that as well,  can be vicious!
Cool, thanks, I'll watch that! x3

Tks for the heads up. That was a very enjoyable 44 minutes I just watched in hd on my pc. Streamed from cbc for those that missed it. Sure is nice with no commercials. Great show and photography on a rarely seen critter that has always sort of had that mystique about it.  Cheers
Wolverine or honey badger? whos tougher?
Hey Thanks for the pic Drifter  Would love to see one in the wild--only rumors of sitings in these parts  Enjoy your Spring Dude  Cheers  Paul
Just a follow up...4 x4-Thanks-- and all who may have missed the show  watch online now.  more docs at cbc.ca/natureofthings  ID1
